result.execSummary:
The defendant Lawrence D Vaughan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
BOTH COUNTS: Provide DNA sample; pay the DNA surcharges. All costs, surcharges and assessment (including the DNA surcharges) to be paid by 11-28-2022 to convert to a civil judgment.
- Restitution set at zero.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence; with credit for 30 days time served.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count 1; with credit for 11 days time served

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lawrence D Vaughan

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lawrence D Vaughan in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Defendant Lawrence D Vaughan in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
AS TO COUNTS 1 & 3:
Defendant changes his/her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his/her plea, advised of his/her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions/elements and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
AS TO COUNT 2: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered case dismissed and read in.

Sentencing hearing proceeded with statements from state, defense and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 1
The Court ordered the Defendant to:
- Serve 30 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 30 days time served.
AS TO COUNT 3:
The Court ordered the Defendant to:
- Serve 30 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to COUNT 1 with credit for 11 days time served.

Court set restitution at zero.
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharges.

All costs, surcharges and assessment  (including the DNA surcharges) to be paid by 11/28/2022 to convert to a civil judgment.

Appeal rights given.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit, received and filed

Defendant Lawrence D Vaughan in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   SPD Fuentes informed the court that defense is in a resolution posture and requested a plea and sentencing date in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Michael V Fuentes in court, defendant Lawrence D Vaughan not in court, in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for pre-trial conference. Court waives defendants appearance. 
Defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates. Defense further advises they are demanding a speedy trial.  Court orders matter adjourned back to Branch 37.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Lawrence D Vaughan in court with attorney Robert W Peterson.  Defendant Lawrence D Vaughan in custody.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lawrence D Vaughan appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
